What is the purpose of the `revokeidentity` command in Verus?
The `revokeidentity` command is used to revoke an identity in Verus.

revokeidentity "nameorID" (returntx) (tokenrevoke) (feeoffer) (sourceoffunds) Arguments    "returntx"            (bool,  optional) defaults to false and transaction is sent, if true, transaction is signed by this wallet and returned    "tokenrevoke"           (bool,  optional) defaults to false, if true, the tokenized ID control token, if one exists, will be used to revoke    "feeoffer"            (value, optional) non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction    "sourceoffunds"          (string, optional) transparent or private address to source all funds for fees to preserve privacy of the identity Result: Examples: > verus revokeidentity "nameorID" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "revokeidentity", "params": ["nameorID"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What are the optional arguments for the `revokeidentity` command?

The optional arguments for the `revokeidentity` command are:

1. `returntx`: a boolean value that defaults to false, indicating whether the transaction should be sent or returned signed by the wallet.
2. `tokenrevoke`: a boolean value that defaults to false, indicating whether the tokenized ID control token should be used to revoke the identity.
3. `feeoffer`: a value specifying a non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction.
4. `sourceoffunds`: a string specifying a transparent or private address to source all funds for fees, preserving the privacy of the identity.

revokeidentity "nameorID" (returntx) (tokenrevoke) (feeoffer) (sourceoffunds) Arguments    "returntx"            (bool,  optional) defaults to false and transaction is sent, if true, transaction is signed by this wallet and returned    "tokenrevoke"           (bool,  optional) defaults to false, if true, the tokenized ID control token, if one exists, will be used to revoke    "feeoffer"            (value, optional) non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction    "sourceoffunds"          (string, optional) transparent or private address to source all funds for fees to preserve privacy of the identity Result: Examples: > verus revokeidentity "nameorID" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "revokeidentity", "params": ["nameorID"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I use the `revokeidentity` command to revoke an identity in Verus?

You can use the `revokeidentity` command to revoke an identity in Verus by running the following command:

```
verus revokeidentity "nameorID"
```

Alternatively, you can also use the Verus RPC API to revoke an identity by sending a JSON-RPC request with the following format:

```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "revokeidentity", "params": ["nameorID"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

revokeidentity "nameorID" (returntx) (tokenrevoke) (feeoffer) (sourceoffunds) Arguments    "returntx"            (bool,  optional) defaults to false and transaction is sent, if true, transaction is signed by this wallet and returned    "tokenrevoke"           (bool,  optional) defaults to false, if true, the tokenized ID control token, if one exists, will be used to revoke    "feeoffer"            (value, optional) non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction    "sourceoffunds"          (string, optional) transparent or private address to source all funds for fees to preserve privacy of the identity Result: Examples: > verus revokeidentity "nameorID" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "revokeidentity", "params": ["nameorID"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
